results.title: Flash Gordon. Vol. 01
results.brief_description: Episodes one to six of this cult movie serial. Episode 1: “The Planet of peril”. Flash (Larry “Buster” Crabbe), Dale Arden (Jean Rogers) and Dr. Zarkov (Frank Shannon) are captured by Ming the Merciless (Charles Middleton) ruler of the planet, Mongo. Bent on galactic conquest, Ming stops at nothing in his attempt to destroy the Earth. Zarkov is forced to work in Ming’s lab and Flash finds himself wrestling with three fanged men. Episode 2: “The Tunnel of terror”. Dale is subjected to Ming’s “dehumanizer” in order to marry her. Thun of the Lion-Men joins forces with Flash and together they sneak into the Palace and find Zarkov. Flash races to save Dale only to be confronted with the Fire Dragon. Episode 3: “Captured by sharkmen”. After falling through a trap door, Flash and Dale land in an underground river and are taken prisoner by the Sharkmen. Betrayed by their ruler, Kala, Flash becomes entombed in a flooding tank - occupied by Octosak. Episode 4: “Battling the sea beast”. Aura and Thun arrive just in time to save Flash with their ray guns but the underwater city’s controls are destroyed and water starts to flood in. Episode 5: “The Destroying ray”. Using a ray to counteract the magnetic power that holds Kala’s Shark Palace underwater, Ming raises the underwater city to the surface. Enter Prince Barin, true ruler of Mongo who befriends Zarkov. Together they head off to rescue Flash, only to encounter the evil Hawk Men. Episode 6: “Flaming torture”. Flash soon discovers that the planet Mongo is a melting pot of evil leaders when he’s taken prisoner by yet another: Vultan. Flash faces execution in the dreaded “Static Room”…

results.title: Recontre
results.creator_credit: Laurent Coderre, Margaret Pettigrew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cardboard cutouts explode, twirl, disintegrate and form shapes in a delightful, airy film that describes man’s initiation to life, his journey through it, with its inevitable ups and downs, and his final triumph as the person he struggled to become. Music by Sharon Smith.

results.title: Five steps to better farm living
results.creator_credit: Evelyn Cherry and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Agricultural economist R.R. Hare discusses the importance of a good farm management. Profitable farming depends upon effective land use, good livestock management, effective use of labor, efficient use of capital and optimum business size. Victory Bonds are recommended as a way of saving money to make farm improvements following the end of World War II.

results.title: Flamenco at 5.15
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Kathleen Shannon, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: FLAMENCO AT 5.15 is a visual and emotional thriller. It is an impressionistic record of a flamenco dance class given to senior students of the National Ballet School of Canada by two great teachers from Spain, Susana and Antonio Robledo. The film shows the beautiful young North American dancers inspired by the flamenco rhythms and mesmerised by Susana’s extraordinary energy, joyously merging with an ancient gypsy culture. (Awards: Academy Award, Hollywood; Salerno; San Francisco; Cracow; Valladolid; Yorkton; New York)

results.title: Five short films by Clayton Jacobson
results.creator_credit: Clayton Jacobson, Bison Films, Ghost Pictures and Five Easy Pieces
results.brief_description: Clayton Jacobson graduated from Swinburne Film and Television School in 1984 and has subsequently directed numerous music videos, television advertisements and award-winning short films. ‘Environmental’: A man is threatened by a masked bandit who breaks into his home. But instead of cleaning the house out, this thief cleans it up! A story about environmental awareness, an obsessively green bandit and a man’s conversion from litter dropper to neat freak. ‘The Pin Drop’: A film without words, this darkly gruesome bloody tale of murder is beautifully filmed in atmospheric black and white. ‘Tickler’: A couple debate the size, shape and purchase of a vibrator as they sit in a car outside a sex shop in this funny engaging film. ‘Tanaka’ When a young Japanese man is sent by his family to Australia to oversee his uncle’s funeral, he is thrust into a world of cross-cultural love, grief and misunderstanding. ‘I Love U’: The silent world of deaf lovers is shattered by obsession, denial and a recurring dream of betrayal. Cast: Kym Gygnell, Rhys Muldoon (Environmental)—Ronald Jacobson, Raylene Gordon (The Pin Drop)—Clayton Jacobson, Chris Bartlett (Tickler)—Morihiko Hasebe, Ronald Jacobson, Chris Bartlett, Ant Keogh (Tanaka)—Fiona Crisp, Ross Onley-Zerkel, Richard Neville (I Love U). ‘Tanaka’ is also available separately on VHS.

results.title: Five sides of a coin = 5 sides of a coin
results.creator_credit: Paul Kell, Jana Ritter, Canada Council for the Arts, Anomaly Collective and 7th Art Releasing
results.brief_description: An informative documentary on the rise of the five elements of the Hip Hop movement - Emcee’ing, DeeJay’ing, Breakin,’ Graffiti Writing and Beatboxing. An overview for the novice or an exciting compilation for the fan, this films serves to broaden the knowledge base of the viewer by providing an understanding of the complexity of the worldwide Hip Hop genre of music. Hip Hop is more than just the commercial hits on MTV: the complex rhyming of MCs, the skill of the turntable DJs, the fancy moves of the Break Dancers, the artistry of Graffiti and the wonder of the human voice in reproducing sounds through Beatboxing are all shown and discussed by those passionate about the culture. Some of the artists featured include: Common, DeLaSoul, Grandmaster Flash, DJ Jazzy Jay, Mercedies Ladies, Prince Paul and many others. Animation by Skilla, original music by Manifest, Son of Mac, Zinndeadly, Big Dro, DJ Emergency.

results.title: Five little warriors = Wu hu jiang
results.creator_credit: Zhan Qiang, Wang Yiwan and Children's Film Studio (China)
results.brief_description:
The film tells the story about five little kids and their table tennis coach. Known as ‘five little warriors’ for their outstanding table tennis skills, Hou, the biggest of the five, and his teammates lost an important match, which made them unhappy. What frustrated them even more was that their new coach was a young lady, Ms Yang who could win no respect from the kids at all. Hou is the mastermind of all the tricks and incorporation plotted against their coach. However, Yang is patient and sacrifices a lot of her personal time and even health for the kids. This upsets Yang’s boyfriend, a ping pong star in the national team, who worries Yang’s health and wants to transfer her to the Sports Association, rather than wasting time with the kids. Yang reminds her boyfriend how he begins his career like the kids, who are the future of the country. Yang’s boyfriend changed his attitude and helps the kids as well. The ‘five little warriors’ win the first prize at the Youth Table Tennis Match again.

The Children’s Film Studio was established on 1st June, 1981. As China’s only children’s film studio, it produces films, including cartoons and TV programs for children. It is well-known that table tennis is the national sport of China. It played an important role in China’s international relations with other countries, particularly with the U.S. in 1972 when the U.S. table tennis team was invited to visit China. This marked a thaw in China-US relations and is known as “Ping Pong Diplomacy”. Table tennis has been a symbol of national pride and is very popular in China as can be seen in the film. Five Little Warriors won a major award at an Iran International Film Festival. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: Five get into trouble. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: The children are on a cycling holiday when they are joined by Richard Kent, the twelve year old son of rich parents. Two villains chase and try to capture him, but he escapes. They later kidnap Dick by mistake and take him to the gloomy and ancient manor house, Owl’s Den.

results.title: Five easy pizzas
results.creator_credit: Ray Boseley, Clayton Jacobson, Garry Richards, Mark Hanlin, Jo Bell and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A collection of five Australian short comedy films, linked by a pizza delivery man having one of those days when nothing seems to go right. “Bernie’s Magic Moment”: a fanatical Collingwood football club supporter (Chris Haywood) is doing the ironing and gets carried away watching a football match; “Gran’s Big Adventure”: Bunney Brooke plays an old lady who becomes locked in a sofa and ends up having a ball of a time; “Midday Crisis”: a man training to be a private investigator discovers the wisdom in not interfering in a neighbour’s business; “Environmental”: a nerdy guy (Kym Gyngell) is terrorised by a radical greenie; “Prickly Heat”: the pizza delivery man finally loses his cool completely. A very funny and stylish collection of films.

results.title: Five bells: sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Dean Semler, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sydney Harbour, the most beautiful in the world, is celebrated in this lyrical documentary. Pre-dawn a memory of the Harbour’s convict past appears like a dream, but as the sun rises and the trawlers trek back with their cargo of prawns the Harbour comes to life in 1978. Australia’s multi-cultural society is epitomised in this film.
